entry.title: Newsletter #96
entry.content:
TechThursday is here!

We hope you are enjoying the lesser working hours because of Ramadan, here are the usual links to enjoy over the weekend.

and a huge list of links for you:

  • Do you really want to use XA with MySQL?

  • You Build It, You Run It

  • Teach, Don’t Tell / Steve Losh

  • How Docker Was Born

  • Sacrificial Architecture

  • Tor for Technologists

  • Commit messages are not titles – Antirez weblog

  • nd documentation viewer on terminal

  • xhyve – Lightweight Virtualization on OS X Based on bhyve | pagetable.com

  • ailispaw/boot2docker-xhyve

  • It’s All Good: The False Dichotomy Between Planned and Improvisational Projects

  • Developers Life is a Trade-Off

  • It’s Not Just Standing Up: Patterns for Daily Standup Meetings

  • Learn JS in one picture

  • The most important skill in software development

  • GitFlow considered harmful

  • The Code Climate Platform – Code Climate Blog

  • Devops for developers

  • New Relic’s Docker Monitoring Now Generally Available

  • Why monads have not taken the Common Lisp world by storm (2008)

  • My notes on Amazon’s ECS (EC2 Container Service), aka Docker on AWS

  • How Docker Was Born

  • Someone said that 30% of the images on the Docker Registry contain vulnerabilities

  • Symfony Support: Stack Overflow as the Main Medium

  • Creating the Zero Inbox Animation | Prototyping with Framer

  • Framer – Prototyping Tool for Designing UI, Interaction and Animation

  • How to Make a Prototype in 3 Days — Medium

  • Material Design is design science | HeyDesigner

  • Are good gaming laptops good for programming?
